alert.note: Alert for Arapahoe; Elbert (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued July 06 at 2:54PM MDT until July 06 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver Colorado has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Elbert County in east central Colorado... South central Arapahoe County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 330 PM MDT. * At 254 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 11 miles north of Kiowa, or 30 miles southeast of Denver, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Elbert and south central Arapahoe Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: This Tornado Warning replaces the Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued for the same area. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
